fpmExplorer:Page.title: Custom Root View
fpmExplorer:Page.introduction: If neither of the standard root views provided by SAP Fiori elements suit your needs, you can create and register a custom root view. The following standard root views are available: NavContainer and Flexible Column Layout.

MessageStrip.text: The sample shows a list report where the NavContainer control is used in a custom root view.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Add a NavContainer or FlexibleColumnLayout to Your Custom Root View
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Ensure your custom root view contains an sap.m.NavContainer (or an sap.f.FlexibleColumnLayout) as the main container for your application content.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Use the Appropriate Controller for Your Custom Root View
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Ensure your custom root view uses the sap.fe.core.rootView.NavContainer controller (or sap.fe.core.rootView.Fcl controller), or a controller extending it. This enables the default SAP Fiori elements features in your custom root view.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Set the Control ID for the Main Container
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Ensure the ID of the NavContainer (or FlexibleColumnLayout) is set as 'appContent' or is defined in the application manifest under '/sap.ui5/routing/config/controlId'. This allows the router to target the correct container.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Register the Root View in the Manifest
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Ensure your custom root is defined in the application manifest under '/sap.ui5/rootView/viewName'. This registers your custom root view for the application.
